name: Parent-Child Mother Goose Program
description:
The Parent-Child Mother Goose Program is an organization with over twenty years of experience dedicated to sharing the power of rhymes, songs, and stories with parents and their children, from newborns to age four. It aims to strengthen the bond between parents and children, enhance developmental skills in children, and build supportive community connections. 

Why is the Parent-Child Mother Goose Program important?
The program emphasizes that the bond between parent and child is essential. It provides practical tools like rhymes, songs, and stories that can be easily integrated into daily life. This helps parents create a joyful and stimulating environment, leading to stronger connections, improved communication skills, and positive family patterns. It also aims to prevent isolation and promote mental and physical well-being.

name: Old City Hall: Self-Guided Tour
description:
Explore the timeless interiors of Old City Hall and marvel at the grand staircase, stunning murals, and the historic former City Council Chamber â€” each space a witness to Toronto's past. Enjoy its Romanesque Revival architecture, historic courtrooms and intricate iron finishings. Completed in 1899 and designed by architect E.J. Lennox, the building served as the city's municipal hub for more than 60 years.

Click on the event website link under contact information to access an audio tour.
